question_text: A technician installs a high-end GPU, but the system randomly crashes under load. The PSU has a 6-pin PCIe connector, but the GPU requires 8-pin. Whatâ€™s the MOST likely cause?
answer_options: CPU power draw is too high
Not enough lanes on the PCIe slot
explanation: Using a 6-pin connector in place of an 8-pin on a high-power GPU can cause undervoltage under load, leading to instability.
